post.description:
Validate wether a ScanSpec[str] can produce a viable scan.

Args:
    spec: The scanspec to validate

Returns:
    ValidResponse: A canonical version of the spec if it is valid.
        An error otherwise.

Generate midpoints from a scanspec.

A scanspec can produce bounded points (i.e. a point is valid if an
axis is between a minimum and and a maximum, see /bounds). The midpoints
are the middle of each set of bounds.

Args:
    request: Scanspec and formatting info.

Returns:
    MidpointsResponse: Midpoints of the scan

Generate bounds from a scanspec.

A scanspec can produce points with lower and upper bounds.

Args:
    request: Scanspec and formatting info.

Returns:
    BoundsResponse: Bounds of the scan

Generate gaps from a scanspec.

A scanspec may indicate if there is a gap between two frames.
The array returned corresponds to whether or not there is a gap
after each frame.

Args:
    spec: Scanspec and formatting info.

Returns:
    GapResponse: Bounds of the scan

Calculate the smallest step in a scan, both absolutely and per-axis.

Ignore any steps of size 0.

Args:
    spec: The spec of the scan

Returns:
    SmallestStepResponse: A description of the smallest steps in the spec

total_frames.title: Total Frames
total_frames.description: Total number of frames in spec

returned_frames.title: Returned Frames
returned_frames.description: Total of number of frames in this response, may be less than total_frames due to downsampling etc.

lower.title: Lower
lower.description: Lower bounds of scan frames if different from midpoints

upper.title: Upper
upper.description: Upper bounds of scan frames if different from midpoints

x_axis.title: X Axis
x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec

y_axis.title: Y Axis
y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec

x_middle.title: X Middle
x_middle.description: The central x point of the circle

y_middle.title: Y Middle
y_middle.description: The central y point of the circle

Circle_str_.title: Circle
Circle_str_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within an xy circle of given radius.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Circle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 1, 3, 10) * ~Line("x", 0, 2, 10)
    spec = grid & Circle("x", "y", 1, 2, 0.9)

CombinationOf_str_-Input.title: CombinationOf
CombinationOf_str_-Input.description: Abstract baseclass for a combination of two regions, left and right.

CombinationOf_str_-Output.title: CombinationOf
CombinationOf_str_-Output.description: Abstract baseclass for a combination of two regions, left and right.

left.description: The left-hand Spec to Concat, midpoints will appear earlier

right.description: The right-hand Spec to Concat, midpoints will appear later

gap.title: Gap
gap.description: If True, force a gap in the output at the join

check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes
check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash

Concat_str_-Input.title: Concat
Concat_str_-Input.description:
Concatenate two Specs together, running one after the other.

Each Dimension of left and right must contain the same axes. Typically
formed using `Spec.concat`.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("x", 1, 3, 3).concat(Line("x", 4, 5, 5))

left.description: The left-hand Spec to Concat, midpoints will appear earlier

right.description: The right-hand Spec to Concat, midpoints will appear later

gap.title: Gap
gap.description: If True, force a gap in the output at the join

check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes
check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash

Concat_str_-Output.title: Concat
Concat_str_-Output.description:
Concatenate two Specs together, running one after the other.

Each Dimension of left and right must contain the same axes. Typically
formed using `Spec.concat`.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("x", 1, 3, 3).concat(Line("x", 4, 5, 5))

DifferenceOf_str_-Input.title: DifferenceOf
DifferenceOf_str_-Input.description:
A point is in DifferenceOf(a, b) if in a and not in b.

Typically created with the ``-`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) - Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True, False, False, False])

DifferenceOf_str_-Output.title: DifferenceOf
DifferenceOf_str_-Output.description:
A point is in DifferenceOf(a, b) if in a and not in b.

Typically created with the ``-`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) - Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True, False, False, False])

x_axis.title: X Axis
x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec

y_axis.title: Y Axis
y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec

x_middle.title: X Middle
x_middle.description: The central x point of the ellipse

y_middle.title: Y Middle
y_middle.description: The central y point of the ellipse

x_radius.title: X Radius
x_radius.description: The radius along the x axis of the ellipse

y_radius.title: Y Radius
y_radius.description: The radius along the y axis of the ellipse

Ellipse_str_.title: Ellipse
Ellipse_str_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within an xy ellipse of given radius.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Ellipse
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 3, 8, 10) * ~Line("x", 1 ,8, 10)
    spec = grid & Ellipse("x", "y", 5, 5, 2, 3, 75)

gap.title: Gap
gap.description: Boolean array indicating if there is a gap between each frame

GapResponse.title: GapResponse
GapResponse.description: Presence of gaps in a generated scan.

IntersectionOf_str_-Input.title: IntersectionOf
IntersectionOf_str_-Input.description:
A point is in IntersectionOf(a, b) if in both a and b.

Typically created with the ``&`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) & Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False, False,  True, False, False])

IntersectionOf_str_-Output.title: IntersectionOf
IntersectionOf_str_-Output.description:
A point is in IntersectionOf(a, b) if in both a and b.

Typically created with the ``&`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) & Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False, False,  True, False, False])

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: An identifier for what to move

start.title: Start
start.description: Midpoint of the first point of the line

stop.title: Stop
stop.description: Midpoint of the last point of the line

Line_str_.title: Line
Line_str_.description:
Linearly spaced frames with start and stop as first and last midpoints.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("x", 1, 2, 5)

spec.description: The Spec containing the source midpoints

region.description: The Region that midpoints will be inside

check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes
check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash

Mask_str_-Input.title: Mask
Mask_str_-Input.description:
Restrict Spec to only midpoints that fall inside the given Region.

Typically created with the ``&`` operator. It also pushes down the
``& | ^ -`` operators to its `Region` to avoid the need for brackets on
combinations of Regions.

If a Region spans multiple Dimension objects, they will be squashed together.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Circle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 3, 3) * Line("x", 3, 5, 5) & Circle("x", "y", 4, 2, 1.2)

See Also: `why-squash-can-change-path`

spec.description: The Spec containing the source midpoints

region.description: The Region that midpoints will be inside

check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes
check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash

Mask_str_-Output.title: Mask
Mask_str_-Output.description:
Restrict Spec to only midpoints that fall inside the given Region.

Typically created with the ``&`` operator. It also pushes down the
``& | ^ -`` operators to its `Region` to avoid the need for brackets on
combinations of Regions.

If a Region spans multiple Dimension objects, they will be squashed together.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Circle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 3, 3) * Line("x", 3, 5, 5) & Circle("x", "y", 4, 2, 1.2)

See Also: `why-squash-can-change-path`

total_frames.title: Total Frames
total_frames.description: Total number of frames in spec

returned_frames.title: Returned Frames
returned_frames.description: Total of number of frames in this response, may be less than total_frames due to downsampling etc.

midpoints.title: Midpoints
midpoints.description: The midpoints of scan frames for each axis

PointsFormat.title: PointsFormat
PointsFormat.description: Formats in which we can return points.

spec.description: The spec from which to generate points

max_frames.title: Max Frames
max_frames.description: The maximum number of points to return, if None will return as many as calculated

format.description: The format in which to output the points data

PointsRequest.title: PointsRequest
PointsRequest.description: A request for generated scan points.

x_axis.title: X Axis
x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec

y_axis.title: Y Axis
y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec

x_verts.title: X Verts
x_verts.description: The Nx1 x coordinates of the polygons vertices

y_verts.title: Y Verts
y_verts.description: The Nx1 y coordinates of the polygons vertices

Polygon_str_.title: Polygon
Polygon_str_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within a rotated xy polygon.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Polygon
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 3, 8, 10) * ~Line("x", 1 ,8, 10)
    spec = grid & Polygon("x", "y", [1.0, 6.0, 8.0, 2.0], [4.0, 10.0, 6.0, 1.0])

Product_str_-Input.title: Product
Product_str_-Input.description:
Outer product of two Specs, nesting inner within outer.

This means that inner will run in its entirety at each point in outer.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 2, 3) * Line("x", 3, 4, 12)

Product_str_-Output.title: Product
Product_str_-Output.description:
Outer product of two Specs, nesting inner within outer.

This means that inner will run in its entirety at each point in outer.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 2, 3) * Line("x", 3, 4, 12)

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: The name matching the axis to mask in spec

min.title: Min
min.description: The minimum inclusive value in the region

max.title: Max
max.description: The minimum inclusive value in the region

Range_str_.title: Range
Range_str_.description:
Mask contains points of axis >= min and <= max.

>>> r = Range("x", 1, 2)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True,  True, False, False])

x_axis.title: X Axis
x_axis.description: The name matching the x axis of the spec

y_axis.title: Y Axis
y_axis.description: The name matching the y axis of the spec

x_min.title: X Min
x_min.description: Minimum inclusive x value in the region

y_min.title: Y Min
y_min.description: Minimum inclusive y value in the region

x_max.title: X Max
x_max.description: Maximum inclusive x value in the region

y_max.title: Y Max
y_max.description: Maximum inclusive y value in the region

angle.title: Angle
angle.description: Clockwise rotation angle of the rectangle

Rectangle_str_.title: Rectangle
Rectangle_str_.description:
Mask contains points of axis within a rotated xy rectangle.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.regions import Rectangle
    from scanspec.specs import Line

    grid = Line("y", 1, 3, 10) * ~Line("x", 0, 2, 10)
    spec = grid & Rectangle("x", "y", 0, 1.1, 1.5, 2.1, 30)

gap.title: Gap
gap.description: If False and the slowest of the stack of Dimension is snaked then the end and start of consecutive iterations of Spec will have no gap

Repeat_str_.title: Repeat
Repeat_str_.description:
Repeat an empty frame num times.

Can be used on the outside of a scan to repeat the same scan many times.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = 2 * ~Line.bounded("x", 3, 4, 1)

If you want snaked axes to have no gap between iterations you can do:

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Repeat

    spec = Repeat(2, gap=False) * ~Line.bounded("x", 3, 4, 1)

.. note:: There is no turnaround arrow at x=4

absolute.title: Absolute
absolute.description: Absolute smallest distance between two points on a single axis

per_axis.title: Per Axis
per_axis.description: Smallest distance between two points on each axis

SmallestStepResponse.title: SmallestStepResponse
SmallestStepResponse.description: Information about the smallest steps between points in a spec.

spec.description: The Spec to run in reverse every other iteration

Snake_str_-Input.title: Snake
Snake_str_-Input.description:
Run the Spec in reverse on every other iteration when nested.

Typically created with the ``~`` operator.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 3, 3) * ~Line("x", 3, 5, 5)

spec.description: The Spec to run in reverse every other iteration

Snake_str_-Output.title: Snake
Snake_str_-Output.description:
Run the Spec in reverse on every other iteration when nested.

Typically created with the ``~`` operator.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("y", 1, 3, 3) * ~Line("x", 3, 5, 5)

x_axis.title: X Axis
x_axis.description: An identifier for what to move for x

y_axis.title: Y Axis
y_axis.description: An identifier for what to move for y

rotate.title: Rotate
rotate.description: How much to rotate the angle of the spiral

Spiral_str_.title: Spiral
Spiral_str_.description:
Archimedean spiral of "x_axis" and "y_axis".

Starts at centre point ("x_start", "y_start") with angle "rotate". Produces
"num" points in a spiral spanning width of "x_range" and height of "y_range"

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Spiral

    spec = Spiral("x", "y", 1, 5, 10, 50, 30)

spec.description: The Spec to squash the dimensions of

check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes
check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash

Squash_str_-Input.title: Squash
Squash_str_-Input.description:
Squash a stack of Dimension together into a single expanded Dimension object.

See Also:
    `why-squash-can-change-path`

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Squash

    spec = Squash(Line("y", 1, 2, 3) * Line("x", 0, 1, 4))

spec.description: The Spec to squash the dimensions of

check_path_changes.title: Check Path Changes
check_path_changes.description: If True path through scan will not be modified by squash

Squash_str_-Output.title: Squash
Squash_str_-Output.description:
Squash a stack of Dimension together into a single expanded Dimension object.

See Also:
    `why-squash-can-change-path`

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Squash

    spec = Squash(Line("y", 1, 2, 3) * Line("x", 0, 1, 4))

axis.title: Axis
axis.description: An identifier for what to move

Static_str_.title: Static
Static_str_.description:
A static frame, repeated num times, with axis at value.

Can be used to set axis=value at every point in a scan.

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line, Static

    spec = Line("y", 1, 2, 3).zip(Static("x", 3))

SymmetricDifferenceOf_str_-Input.title: SymmetricDifferenceOf
SymmetricDifferenceOf_str_-Input.description:
A point is in SymmetricDifferenceOf(a, b) if in either a or b, but not both.

Typically created with the ``^`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) ^ Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True, False,  True, False])

SymmetricDifferenceOf_str_-Output.title: SymmetricDifferenceOf
SymmetricDifferenceOf_str_-Output.description:
A point is in SymmetricDifferenceOf(a, b) if in either a or b, but not both.

Typically created with the ``^`` operator.

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) ^ Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True, False,  True, False])

UnionOf_str_-Input.title: UnionOf
UnionOf_str_-Input.description:
A point is in UnionOf(a, b) if in either a or b.

Typically created with the ``|`` operator

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) | Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True,  True,  True, False])

UnionOf_str_-Output.title: UnionOf
UnionOf_str_-Output.description:
A point is in UnionOf(a, b) if in either a or b.

Typically created with the ``|`` operator

>>> r = Range("x", 0.5, 2.5) | Range("x", 1.5, 3.5)
>>> r.mask({"x": np.array([0, 1, 2, 3, 4])})
array([False,  True,  True,  True, False])

valid_spec.description: The validated version of the spec

left.description: The left-hand Spec to Zip, will appear earlier in axes

right.description: The right-hand Spec to Zip, will appear later in axes

Zip_str_-Input.title: Zip
Zip_str_-Input.description:
Run two Specs in parallel, merging their midpoints together.

Typically formed using `Spec.zip`.

Stacks of Dimension are merged by:

- If right creates a stack of a single Dimension object of size 1, expand it to
  the size of the fastest Dimension object created by left
- Merge individual Dimension objects together from fastest to slowest

This means that Zipping a Spec producing stack [l2, l1] with a Spec
producing stack [r1] will assert len(l1)==len(r1), and produce
stack [l2, l1.zip(r1)].

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("z", 1, 2, 3) * Line("y", 3, 4, 5).zip(Line("x", 4, 5, 5))

left.description: The left-hand Spec to Zip, will appear earlier in axes

right.description: The right-hand Spec to Zip, will appear later in axes

Zip_str_-Output.title: Zip
Zip_str_-Output.description:
Run two Specs in parallel, merging their midpoints together.

Typically formed using `Spec.zip`.

Stacks of Dimension are merged by:

- If right creates a stack of a single Dimension object of size 1, expand it to
  the size of the fastest Dimension object created by left
- Merge individual Dimension objects together from fastest to slowest

This means that Zipping a Spec producing stack [l2, l1] with a Spec
producing stack [r1] will assert len(l1)==len(r1), and produce
stack [l2, l1.zip(r1)].

.. example_spec::

    from scanspec.specs import Line

    spec = Line("z", 1, 2, 3) * Line("y", 3, 4, 5).zip(Line("x", 4, 5, 5))
